decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Heartless Act and Fatal Push, and powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester. The deck aims to maintain board control while applying pressure with its creatures, ultimately overpowering the opponent. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the chances of casting its spells on curve.

The deck focuses on quickly bringing out Arclight Phoenix and using cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger its ability and deal damage to the opponent. Picklock Prankster helps with this strategy by creating additional opportunities to trigger the Phoenix. The deck also includes card draw spells like Consider and Treasure Cruise to maintain tempo and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The deck revolves around utilizing the powerful combo potential of Acererak the Archlich in conjunction with Relic of Legends, supported by a mix of efficient mana dorks and disruptive creatures. By including Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck gains access to an additional resource while maintaining a streamlined game plan. The inclusion of cards like Collected Company and Boseiju, Who Endures further enhances the deck's consistency and ability to withstand disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with a flurry of powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful abilities of Acererak the Archlich and Relic of Legends to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm opponents quickly. By using cards like Collected Company and Gwenna, Eyes of Gaea to search for and play key creatures, along with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and generate value through synergistic interactions. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Honest Rutstein and Atraxa, Grand Unifier adds versatility and protection to the strategy.

The deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to control the board with removal spells and enchantments while slowly building up a board presence with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to further enhance the deck's control and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent with a combination of powerful threats and disruptive elements.

This control deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's resources while gradually building up its own board presence with powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. It also includes card draw and graveyard hate to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's plans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and win through powerful creatures and efficient removal spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent, utilizing cards that allow for direct damage, disruption of the opponent's hand, and creatures with evasion and power. The deck includes a mix of creature removal, hand disruption, and mana fixing to ensure a strong aggro strategy in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format. By deploying threats early and applying pressure consistently, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories through aggressive plays and combat damage.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing efficient creatures and disruption effects. By curving out with early mana acceleration from creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to play threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by putting multiple threats into play at once. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Anointed Peacekeeper provide additional disruption to slow down the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to close out the game quickly.

The main goal of this deck is to efficiently cast spells in order to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. By using cards like Opt, Consider, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise to dig through the deck and fill the graveyard, as well as cards like Picklock Prankster and Lightning Axe to control the board, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Phoenixes and close out the game quickly. It also includes some counterspells and burn spells for added versatility and protection.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Using cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's resources, Kaito and Moon-Circuit Hacker can efficiently finish off opponents. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Brazen Borrower for versatility and Faerie Miscreant for card draw. The mana base is versatile with a mix of lands that can provide both colored mana and utility. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and efficient removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil, the deck aims to generate value through sacrificing creatures and dealing damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional card advantage, while cards like Fatal Push and Bloodtithe Harvester help to control the battlefield. With a solid mana base and the support of Jegantha, the Wellspring, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and attrition.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven for consistent damage output and disruption. The inclusion of Ygra, Eater of All adds a powerful threat to the deck, while cards like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn help control the opponent's board. Scavenger's Talent provides valuable card advantage, while the mana base is designed to support the deck's efficient curve. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of quick creatures and disruptive plays.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher to apply early pressure, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out helps maintain card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of impactful creatures and efficient removal, this deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to use efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher alongside powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for a swift victory. The deck also includes some disruption with Duress and Blade of the Oni to keep the opponent off balance. With a mix of powerful creatures, removal, and disruption, this deck aims to win games quickly and decisively.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Heartfire Hero, Emberheart Challenger, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes pump spells like Infuriate and Titan's Strength to enhance the damage output of creatures. With the addition of Jegantha as a companion, the deck focuses on consistent aggression and pressure on the opponent, aiming to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional benefits to assist in closing out games swiftly.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with removal spells like Portable Hole and Supreme Verdict, and drawing cards to find key pieces with Memory Deluge and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also aims to disrupt opponent's strategy with cards like Get Lost and Deduce. The mana base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Hall of Storm Giants to further control the game. The companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value by granting creatures vigilance.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and then use cards like Consider, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to control the opponent's plays. Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder help to mill the opponent's deck and disrupt their strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with the quick reanimation of Arclight Phoenix and efficient spells.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board by utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to constantly search and play powerful creatures from the deck. The deck has a variety of creatures with different abilities and power levels, allowing for flexibility in gameplay depending on the situation. By combining control elements with the ability to consistently bring out strong creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value and flexibility as a companion, enhancing the deck's overall strategy.

This aggro Jund deck focuses on sacrificing creatures and dealing direct damage to the opponent. It utilizes Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven for constant sacrificing and Mayhem Devil for additional damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act to control the board. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds versatility. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature sacrifice, direct damage, and removal spells to secure victory in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 match.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and dealing direct damage to the opponent. By utilizing Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, Mayhem Devil, and other sacrificial outlets, this deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while generating incremental advantage. The inclusion of Ygra, Eater of All and Scavenger's Talent helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and provide additional value. With a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn, this deck looks to control the board and close out the game quickly.

The deck revolves around using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells. It focuses on combo pieces such as Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field multiple times, enabling explosive turns. The deck also includes digging spells like Consider and Dig Through Time to find combo pieces efficiently. Additionally, it incorporates control elements like Anger of the Gods to handle opposing threats. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces, generate mana with Lotus Field, and cast game-winning spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Greasefang Parhelion combo by utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out to generate tokens and pressure opponents. Overlord of the Balemurk and Bloodtithe Harvester provide additional threats and support. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. The inclusion of powerful vehicles like Parhelion II and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship allows for additional sources of damage and evasion. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by controlling the board through removal spells like Heartless Act, Fatal Push, and Sheoldred's Edict. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Unstoppable Slasher and Bloodletter of Aclazotz to finish off the opponent. The deck also uses supportive cards like Blade of the Oni and Graveyard Trespasser to gain advantage. Additionally, the mana base includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin to further control the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act. It also utilizes powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodletter of Aclazotz to close out the game. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility and consistency, with utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through a combination of hand disruption and powerful creatures.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to clear the way. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provides a powerful late-game threat, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can give a boost to the team. The land base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck with options for both mana fixing and damage output.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disruption spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. Key cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker allow for early damage while cards like Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also features removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to black and red sources, enabling the deck to consistently play its powerful threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

Fast-paced aggro deck centered around utilizing low-cost creatures and combat tricks to deal quick damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some burn spells to finish off the opponent or deal with threats on the board. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion that provides additional mana fixing and the potential to ramp up the aggression. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and direct damage spells.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with angel creatures and gaining life triggers to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using cards like Bishop of Wings, Resplendent Angel, and Righteous Valkyrie, the deck aims to create a powerful and aggressive board presence. Collected Company provides additional creature options, while cards like Skyclave Apparition help control the opponent's board. The deck also includes some enchantment removal and protection spells to ensure its creatures can continue to apply pressure. With mana acceleration from Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and powerful land choices, the deck can quickly establish dominance on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on fast aggression and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures. By utilizing cards like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and buff each other for powerful attacks. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Brave the Elements help to protect the creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a strong mana base and flexible removal options like Declaration in Stone, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the board using a combination of removal spells and creatures that generate value over time. It utilizes the commander, Zur, Eternal Schemer, to tutor for powerful enchantments that disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of triome lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana base. It aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, ultimately taking control of the game and gaining incremental advantage until victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent through a combination of powerful creatures like Glarb, Calamity's Augur and various Overlord creatures. Using Zur, Eternal Schemer as a key card, the deck aims to manipulate the opponent's board state with cards like Portable Hole and Vanishing Verse, while also utilizing Leyline Binding to lockdown key threats. With a mix of removal spells and mana fixing lands, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and establish board dominance to secure the win.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cheap instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for multiple attacks. It also includes disruptive spells like Jwari Disruption and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's game plan, while drawing cards with Opt, Consider, and Treasure Cruise to maintain hand advantage. The addition of Picklock Prankster provides additional pressure and tempo, making it a fast-paced aggressive deck that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal a significant amount of damage to the opponent. It utilizes cheap spells like Opt and Consider to cycle through the deck quickly and fill the graveyard with spells, while also running disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Jwari Disruption to protect its game plan. The deck also includes card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Artist's Talent to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and utilize its aggressive power. By maximizing card draw and cheap spells like Consider and Opt, the deck aims to consistently bring back Phoenix and deal damage to the opponent. Picklock Prankster helps enable the Phoenix strategy by providing additional spells to cast. Other cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe provide removal and protection while also fueling the graveyard for Phoenix. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with fast, powerful threats and card advantage.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent early in the game, utilizing cards like Boros Charm, Lightning Helix, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal direct damage. The deck also includes creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Hired Claw to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of burn spells and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with damage.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. Cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage provide early pressure, while spells like Lightning Helix and Boros Charm can either target creatures or go directly to the opponent's life total. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace of play, overwhelming opponents before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance further punishes opponents for playing spells.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of burn spells and efficient creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells to control the board and clear the way for powerful attackers like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix for direct damage and protection. With a strong mana base and the potential for consistent damage output, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures and using combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It aims to establish early board presence with cards like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, then uses cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Venerated Loxodon to pump up its creatures and push for damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Gleeful Demolition to control the opponent's board. With its aggressive playstyle and efficient creatures, this deck aims to win by pressuring the opponent and closing out the game before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By using efficient removal like Fatal Push and countermagic like Spell Pierce, the deck aims to clear the way for creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes evasion creatures like Brazen Borrower and Faerie Mastermind to ensure consistent damage output. With a mix of disruption and aggressive threats, this deck aims to control the game while putting pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo with supporting cards to protect and enhance the combo pieces. It utilizes Elenda, Saint of Dusk and Greasefang, Okiba Boss to generate tokens and gain value. Kiora, the Rising Tide and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide additional synergy with the tokens. The deck includes cards like Tainted Indulgence and Thoughtseize for disruption, as well as Dig Through Time for card selection. The goal is to establish a board presence with the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana fixing and ramp. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Questing Druid provide early threats, while spells like Wizard's Lightning and Play with Fire can handle opposing creatures or target the opponent directly. The land base is designed to support the mana requirements of the deck while also providing flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on flooding the battlefield with aggressive creatures like Questing Druid, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Atarka's Command and Monstrous Rage provide additional damage and pump up the team. The deck also includes removal spells like Play with Fire and Screaming Nemesis to deal with threats. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility to the deck's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently to secure victory in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice and disruption effects to control the board while dealing consistent damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven with cards like Mayhem Devil and Bloodtithe Harvester, the deck aims to create a threatening board presence while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency and power to the overall game plan.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on creating value through sacrificing creatures and dealing direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to generate consistent pings of damage, while also leveraging Mayhem Devil and Ygra, Eater of All to punish opponents for each sacrifice. The deck is able to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Deadly Dispute and Scavenger's Talent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for powerful plays throughout the game.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats and disruption. Utilizing sacrifice synergies with Cauldron Familiar, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Mayhem Devil, the deck looks to control the board while dealing direct damage to the opponent. Ygra, Eater of All provides additional pressure and Witch's Oven acts as a versatile engine. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act help keep the opponent's board in check, while Scavenger's Talent provides card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo to overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to facilitate the combo, along with additional support cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Scrapwork Mutt for additional threats. By combining efficient removal and disruption with a powerful combo finish, the deck aims to control the game and win quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful multicolored spells and creatures to control the game and outvalue opponents. With Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the centerpiece, the deck aims to generate card advantage and control the board with versatile removal spells like Vanishing Verse and Lightning Helix. The deck also includes a toolbox of cards that can be accessed through Bring to Light, providing answers to a wide range of threats. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for longer games and additional value opportunities.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, targeted removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, and controlling the board with cards like Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber and Strict Proctor. It also includes powerful creatures like Varragoth, Bloodsky Sire and Sheoldred's Edict to pressure the opponent. The mana base enables the deck to consistently cast its spells and activate its abilities by including cards like Mutavault and Godless Shrine.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful board presence through the interaction of creatures and spells that synergize well together. It aims to discover and utilize the potential of cards such as Trumpeting Carnosaur, Spark Double, and Greater Tanuki to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds a unique element to the deck. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Leyline Binding and Quintorius Kand for control and protection. Ultimately, the deck's strategy revolves around combo plays and efficient card interactions to achieve victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Unstoppable Slasher and Bloodtithe Harvester, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower. Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can provide card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Blade of the Oni. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with a mix of dual lands and utility lands.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on applying early pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross, backed up by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board. The deck also includes powerful late-game threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Liliana of the Veil to close out games. The mana base is built around efficient dual lands to ensure the deck can cast its spells on curve and maintain a consistent aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent's life total through aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily chipping away at their life total. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive curve, allowing it to consistently apply pressure and close out games quickly.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent through early aggression and efficient removal spells. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while also having a solid creature base with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also has a strong late game presence with powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using Rakdos-colored cards, aiming to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. It includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the game early on. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional value and flexibility to the deck. By utilizing a mix of creatures, spells, and lands, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of direct damage, creature combat, and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Acererak and Relic of Legends, along with support from other legendary creatures like Gwenna and Atraxa. The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also utilizing cards like Kinnan, Bonder Prodigy to generate additional mana. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful legendary creatures and synergistic interactions, ultimately leading to a strong board presence and potential for combo finishes.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to swarm the board with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elite Spellbinder, disrupt opponent's plays with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, and finish off the game with powerful attacks from Aven Interrupter and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while also providing disruption to control the pace of the game. With the use of Collected Company and efficient mana production, this deck looks to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful green creatures and spells. It also includes various control elements to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, provides additional card advantage and utility. The deck includes a mix of creatures with abilities that can help control the board and impactful spells like Genesis Wave to overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats. It aims to establish a dominant board presence and control the game through ramping and efficient card advantage.

The deck revolves around utilizing Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Valgavoth, Terror Eater, while disrupting opponent's strategies with removal and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells and disruption, while setting up for a game-winning combo with Transmogrify. By efficiently controlling the board and disrupting opponents' plans, the deck can set up its combo and quickly close out games. The deck focuses on assembling its combo pieces and disrupting opponent's strategies to gain a competitive advantage and secure victories.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. The deck also includes a mix of versatile removal spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi to help maintain board control. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan and provide the necessary colors for its spells.

The deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It aims to remove threats with cards like Portable Hole and Supreme Verdict, counter key spells with Dovin's Veto, and generate card advantage with Memory Deluge and No More Lies. The planeswalkers Narset and Teferi help control the game and limit the opponent's options. The deck also has utility lands like Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage to deal with problematic non-basic lands. By controlling the game and outvaluing the opponent, it seeks to win through attrition and resource advantage.

This deck revolves around controlling the game with powerful Overlord creatures and removal spells, while utilizing Zur, Eternal Schemer's ability to search for key enchantments. With a strong mana base and versatile removal options, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by controlling the board and gaining incremental advantages. Leyline Binding provides additional control and disruption, while Vanishing Verse handles troublesome permanents. With a focus on synergy and resource management, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and dominate the game through strategic plays and efficient use of resources.
